body:
Hi @SharpFu, thanks for the issue!

This is a problem in a transitive dependency so it doesn't seem like there's anything we can do at this point. Also, according 
 to https://github.com/gkz/optionator/issues/44#issuecomment-1518171047 this isn't a possible problem for eslint users because the dependency in question is only used with predefined option descriptions, not with user input.

Given the above, I'm closing this issue. If and when the problem is fixed in the dependencies, we could update eslint's package.json if that would help remove the warning.

issue.title: ðŸš§Redos vulnerability in Wordwrap

issue.body:

[x] Other, please explain:

Updates `optionator` dependency to the latest v0.9.3.

This ensures that invalid version v0.9.2 (as mentioned in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/17317) won't be used, and fixes the security warning reported in #17117.

body: Hi @nzakas When will this be released on npm?

> Hi @nzakas When will this be released on npm?

You can track #17296

issue.title: word-wrap vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service

repository.name: word-wrap
repository.description: Wrap words to a specified length.

issue.body:
All versions of the package word-wrap are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) due to the usage of an insecure regular expression within the result variable.

![Screenshot 2023-06-28 at 12 16 27](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/word-wrap/assets/1800887/7a9172d2-e8a5-48e2-95cb-cfaced31061c)

issue.title: Override unmaintained word-wrap package with a currently maintained fork to resolve CVE

repository.name: jupiter
repository.description: Jupiter is a University of Alberta Libraries-based initiative to create a sustainable and extensible digital asset management system. This is phase 2 (Digitization).

issue.body: Override unmaintained word-wrap node package with a currently maintained fork ([aashutoshrathi/word-wrap](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@aashutoshrathi/word-wrap/v/1.2.6)) to resolve CVE

issue.title: CVE fix - Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) on dependency 'word-wrap'
